--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Firedrill tried to slow down, as he heard his passenger cough. The 
wings
> rubbing against him didnt bother him to much, but he was not 
acostumed
> to riding with a passenger, and since they were on ancient earth, 
didnt
> think he would need to. He slowly followed Cliffjumper, keeping an 
eye
> on him, as Beachcomber scouted ahead, easily jumping around on the 
rough
> terrain.
*****************
::REDHOT::

    Redhot remained quiet as he rested, grumbling mentally to himself 
with any bump firm enough to jar his wings. He wanted to go someplace 
warm, clean and quiet so he could rest in peace. 
    He could hear the other robots ahead of him and he smiled. It felt 
good to finally find robots he could trust. He had been travelling 
alone far too long.

Northlight
Domnijoe productions 
**************************************
